title: Exodus Chapter 35 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Exodus chapter 35 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Exodus Chapter 35 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Exodus Chapter 35.

questions.question: According to Exodus 35:2, how many days shall work be done before the Sabbath?
options: Six days
Seven days
Five days
Three days
questions.correctAnswer: Six days
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2 states that six days shall work be done, and the seventh day is a Sabbath of rest.

questions.question: What shall happen to anyone who does work on the Sabbath, according to Exodus 35:2?
options: They shall be put to death
They shall be forgiven
They shall be fined
They shall be given rest
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2 says that whosoever doeth work on the Sabbath shall be put to death.

questions.question: What were the Israelites commanded not to kindle on the Sabbath day according to Exodus 35:3?
options: Fire
Bread
Water
Sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: Fire
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:3 clearly states that no fire shall be kindled throughout your habitations on the Sabbath day.

questions.question: What types of materials were the Israelites asked to bring as offerings in Exodus 35:5-6?
options: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair
Iron, copper, wool, silk, and leather
Grain, oil, wine, and silver
Wood, stone, oil, and spices
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5-6 lists these specific materials as offerings to the LORD.

questions.question: Who did Moses say was called by name and filled with the spirit of God to do the work of the tabernacle?
options: Bezaleel
Aholiab
Aaron
Moses
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30 identifies Bezaleel as called by name and filled with the spirit of God for the work.

questions.question: Which tribe was Bezaleel from according to Exodus 35:30?
options: Judah
Dan
Levi
Ephraim
questions.correctAnswer: Judah
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30 says Bezaleel was from the tribe of Judah.

questions.question: What was Bezaleel filled with according to Exodus 35:31?
options: Spirit of God, wisdom, understanding, knowledge
Fire, zeal, strength, courage
Faith, hope, love, patience
Power, might, honor, glory
questions.correctAnswer: Spirit of God, wisdom, understanding, knowledge
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:31 states that Bezaleel was filled with the spirit of God, in wisdom, understanding, and knowledge.

questions.question: Who did God put in Bezaleel's heart to teach, as mentioned in Exodus 35:34?
options: Aholiab
Aaron
Moses
Joshua
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:34 says God put it in Bezaleel's heart that he may teach both himself and Aholiab.

questions.question: What kinds of work were Bezaleel and Aholiab skilled in according to Exodus 35:35?
options: Engraving, cunning work, embroidery, weaving
Farming, shepherding, cooking, building
Singing, dancing, teaching, preaching
Carpentry, pottery, painting, sculpting
questions.correctAnswer: Engraving, cunning work, embroidery, weaving
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:35 details their skills in engraving, cunning work, embroidery, and weaving.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 35:21 states that only men brought offerings for the work of the tabernacle.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21 says every one whose heart stirred him up and spirit made willing brought offerings, including men and women.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 35:3, the Israelites were allowed to kindle fire in their homes on the Sabbath day.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:3 explicitly states that no fire should be kindled on the Sabbath day.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 35:28 mentions that spices and oil were brought for the anointing oil and sweet incense.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:28 confirms the bringing of spices and oil for anointing oil and sweet incense.

questions.question: Complete the verse from Exodus 35:10: 'And every wise hearted among you shall come, and make all that the LORD hath _______.'
options: commanded
promised
forbidden
remembered
questions.correctAnswer: commanded
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:10 says the wise-hearted shall come and make all that the LORD hath commanded.

questions.question: What types of garments were made for Aaron and his sons, as mentioned in Exodus 35:19?
options: Holy garments for priestly service
Everyday clothes for travel
Armor for battle
Robes for kingship
questions.correctAnswer: Holy garments for priestly service
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:19 describes the holy garments for Aaron and his sons to minister in the priest's office.

questions.question: What did the rulers bring as offerings for the ephod and breastplate according to Exodus 35:27?
options: Onyx stones and stones to be set
Gold and silver rings
Goats' hair and fine linen
Oil and spices
questions.correctAnswer: Onyx stones and stones to be set
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:27 states that the rulers brought onyx stones and stones to be set for the ephod and breastplate.

medium.title: Exodus Chapter 35 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Exodus Chapter 35 to real-life situations.

questions.question: How does Exodus 35 teach us about the importance of obedience and rest in our spiritual discipline?
options: We must work every day without rest to please God.
Six days we work, but the seventh day is a holy Sabbath of rest commanded by the LORD.
The Sabbath is optional and can be ignored if necessary.
Kindling fire on the Sabbath is encouraged for fellowship.
questions.correctAnswer: Six days we work, but the seventh day is a holy Sabbath of rest commanded by the LORD.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2-3 commands six days of work and a Sabbath of rest to the LORD, forbidding work and kindling fire on the Sabbath, emphasizing obedience and spiritual discipline through rest.

questions.question: A fellow believer is struggling with generosity and giving. Based on Exodus 35, what biblical truth about giving would you share?
options: Only the wealthy are expected to give offerings to God.
Giving should be from a willing heart, and everyone is invited to bring offerings for God's work.
Giving is required only if the church asks for it.
Offerings are only acceptable if given in gold.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving should be from a willing heart, and everyone is invited to bring offerings for God's work.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5, 21-29 emphasize that those whose hearts are stirred and willing bring offerings freely for the tabernacle, teaching generosity and stewardship.

questions.question: Which qualities did God fill Bezaleel with to accomplish his work for the tabernacle?
options: Strength, courage, and leadership
Wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and craftsmanship
Faith, patience, and humility
Power, authority, and wealth
questions.correctAnswer: Wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and craftsmanship
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30-35 describes how God filled Bezaleel with the Spirit of God, giving him wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and skill to do all manner of workmanship for the tabernacle.

questions.question: How can Exodus 35 guide us in developing a faithful work ethic in our daily tasks?
options: Work only when supervised by others.
Do all work hastily to finish quickly.
Use the skills God has given to serve Him with excellence and diligence.
Avoid manual labor and delegate to others.
questions.correctAnswer: Use the skills God has given to serve Him with excellence and diligence.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:10-19 highlights the call for 'wise-hearted' people to use their God-given skills to faithfully build the tabernacle, demonstrating diligence, integrity, and service.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 35, kindling fire on the Sabbath is strictly forbidden and carries a death penalty.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:3 states that no fire shall be kindled in the habitations on the Sabbath day, and Exodus 35:2 warns that whoever works on the Sabbath shall be put to death, underscoring obedience to God's command.

questions.question: A believer wonders how to serve in the church body effectively. What does Exodus 35 teach about serving others with our talents?
options: Only church leaders should serve in special tasks.
Everyone should contribute according to their willing heart and God-given skills.
Service is optional and not important for the congregation.
Only material gifts matter, not skills or labor.
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone should contribute according to their willing heart and God-given skills.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21-35 shows that all, men and women, brought offerings and used their skills willingly to build the tabernacle, teaching the value of serving God and others with our gifts.

questions.question: What lesson about humility and gratitude can we learn from the willingness of the Israelites in Exodus 35?
options: They gave only because they were forced.
Their willingness came from hearts stirred by God, showing gratitude and humility in service.
They gave reluctantly and with complaints.
Only a few gave willingly; most refused.
questions.correctAnswer: Their willingness came from hearts stirred by God, showing gratitude and humility in service.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21, 29 emphasizes that every man and woman whose heart moved them brought offerings willingly, reflecting humble gratitude and devotion to God's work.

questions.question: True or False: According to Exodus 35, God equips believers with wisdom and skills not only for personal benefit but also to teach and serve others.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:34-35 shows that God put it in the hearts of Bezaleel and Aholiab to teach others, demonstrating that God equips His people to serve and instruct the community.

questions.question: When a Christian family is teaching their children about stewardship, how does Exodus 35 provide a practical example?
options: Only adults are responsible for giving and serving.
Giving and serving is a communal act involving everyone, including women skilled in spinning and crafting.
Children should not be involved in giving or service.
Stewardship is about saving money for future use only.
questions.correctAnswer: Giving and serving is a communal act involving everyone, including women skilled in spinning and crafting.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:25-26 shows women spinning yarn and bringing offerings, highlighting communal involvement and teaching stewardship through participation and skill sharing.

questions.question: How does Exodus 35 teach us about the relationship between faith and work?
options: Faith is separate from work and only concerns prayer.
Faith includes faithfully doing the work God commands with skill and willing hearts.
Work is a burden that should be avoided by believers.
Only spiritual leaders should work for the Lord.
questions.correctAnswer: Faith includes faithfully doing the work God commands with skill and willing hearts.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:10-11, 21 encourage the people to work with willing hearts and wisdom as God commanded, showing faith expressed through obedience and diligent work.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Moses said the LORD called by name ________, filled with the Spirit of God, to lead the work of the tabernacle.
options: Bezaleel
Aholiab
Aaron
Miriam
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30 specifically names Bezaleel as the man called and filled by the Spirit of God to lead the workmanship of the tabernacle.

questions.question: What does Exodus 35 teach about the attitude we should have when offering service to the Lord?
options: Service should be given reluctantly.
Service should be done out of obligation only.
Service should come from a willing and stirred heart.
Service is only for those with special talents.
questions.correctAnswer: Service should come from a willing and stirred heart.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21, 22, and 29 emphasize that offerings and service to the Lord should be from a willing heart and spirit, teaching joyful and voluntary dedication.

questions.question: How does Exodus 35 encourage perseverance through trials in the work of the Lord?
options: By promising immediate rewards for all work.
By showing that God equips and inspires those He calls to accomplish His purposes.
By focusing only on leaders to do the work.
By discouraging involvement of the entire community.
questions.correctAnswer: By showing that God equips and inspires those He calls to accomplish His purposes.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:31-35 shows God filling Bezaleel and Aholiab with wisdom and skill, encouraging believers that God provides strength and inspiration to persevere in His work.

questions.question: According to Exodus 35, what is the role of men and women in offering and serving God?
options: Only men are responsible for offerings and service.
Only women contribute through spinning and weaving.
Both men and women willingly bring offerings and use their talents in the service of the tabernacle.
Neither men nor women are required to offer or serve.
questions.correctAnswer: Both men and women willingly bring offerings and use their talents in the service of the tabernacle.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21-26 describes men and women coming with willing hearts to bring gold, silver, materials, and spun yarn, showing shared responsibility in service.

questions.question: What does Exodus 35 teach about honesty and integrity in giving to God's work?
options: Offerings should be given with deceit to impress others.
Give only what is easy or convenient.
Give sincerely and from what is found in your possession, freely and honestly.
Offerings are insignificant and do not matter.
questions.correctAnswer: Give sincerely and from what is found in your possession, freely and honestly.
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:23-24 describes people bringing what was found with them—blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, wood, silver, and brass—demonstrating honest and sincere giving.

hard.title: Exodus Chapter 35 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Exodus Chapter 35.

questions.question: What command concerning work on the seventh day is given in Exodus 35?
options: No work shall be done, and doing work shall result in death
Only priests may work on the seventh day
Work is permitted but no fire is to be kindled
Work is allowed if it is for the tabernacle
questions.correctAnswer: No work shall be done, and doing work shall result in death
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2 states that six days work shall be done but on the seventh day there shall be a holy sabbath of rest, and whosoever worketh on it shall be put to death.

questions.question: According to Exodus 35, what specific action related to fire is forbidden on the Sabbath?
options: Kindle no fire throughout your habitations
Use fire only for sacrifices
Extinguish all fires at sundown
Bring fire from other camps
questions.correctAnswer: Kindle no fire throughout your habitations
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:3 explicitly commands that no fire should be kindled in any of the houses on the Sabbath day, emphasizing rest and cessation from work.

questions.question: What materials were the Israelites instructed to bring as offerings for the tabernacle construction?
options: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair
Iron, bronze, cedar wood, wool, and spices
Silver, frankincense, myrrh, and olive oil
Copper, tin, flax, and animal skins
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5-6 lists these materials specifically as part of the willing offerings the Israelites were to bring for the tabernacle’s construction.

questions.question: Which type of wood is mentioned in Exodus 35 as part of the materials for the tabernacle?
options: Shittim wood
Cedar wood
Oak wood
Acacia wood
questions.correctAnswer: Shittim wood
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:7 mentions 'shittim wood' as one of the specified materials for building the tabernacle components.

questions.question: What role do the 'wise-hearted' individuals play in the building of the tabernacle?
options: They come and make all that the LORD has commanded
They supervise the work but do not participate
They bring offerings but do not build
They perform sacrifices only
questions.correctAnswer: They come and make all that the LORD has commanded
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:10 emphasizes that those with wisdom of heart shall come and do all the work commanded by the LORD for the tabernacle.

questions.question: Which items are included in the tabernacle furnishings as listed in Exodus 35?
options: Ark, mercy seat, table, candlestick, incense altar, altar of burnt offering
Ark, golden calf, bronze serpent, altar of incense
Stone tablets, golden lampstand, bronze basin, ark of the covenant
Altar of incense, golden calf, bronze laver, ark of the covenant
questions.correctAnswer: Ark, mercy seat, table, candlestick, incense altar, altar of burnt offering
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:11-16 lists these specific items as part of the tabernacle and its furnishings to be made by the skilled workers.

questions.question: What was the purpose of the onyx stones and other stones mentioned in Exodus 35?
options: To be set in the ephod and breastplate
To build the altar foundation
To decorate the outer court walls
To be used as weights for the tent curtains
questions.correctAnswer: To be set in the ephod and breastplate
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:9 and 35:27 specify that onyx stones and other stones were to be set for the ephod and the breastplate, garments worn by the high priest.

questions.question: How did the community respond to Moses’ call for offerings and work on the tabernacle?
options: Everyone whose heart was willing brought offerings and materials
Only the priests and Levites contributed
The elders brought the majority of offerings
Only men brought offerings; women did not participate
questions.correctAnswer: Everyone whose heart was willing brought offerings and materials
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21, 29 describe that both men and women, every one whose heart stirred them up, brought their willing offerings for the tabernacle work.

questions.question: Which women’s activities related to the tabernacle construction are highlighted in Exodus 35?
options: Spinning of blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, and goats' hair
Harvesting of flax and weaving baskets
Grinding grain for offerings
Baking bread for the priests
questions.correctAnswer: Spinning of blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, and goats' hair
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:25-26 tells of wise-hearted women spinning with their hands materials needed for the tabernacle service.

questions.question: Who was specifically called by name and endowed with the spirit of God for workmanship in Exodus 35?
options: Bezaleel, son of Uri, of the tribe of Judah
Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan
Moses, son of Amram, of the tribe of Levi
Aaron, son of Amminadab, of the tribe of Levi
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel, son of Uri, of the tribe of Judah
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30-31 states that the LORD called Bezaleel by name and filled him with the spirit of God for skillful work.

questions.question: Besides Bezaleel, who else was filled with wisdom of heart to teach and work according to Exodus 35?
options: Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan
Eleazar, son of Aaron
Caleb, son of Jephunneh
Joshua, son of Nun
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:34-35 explains that God put wisdom in the hearts of both Bezaleel and Aholiab to teach and perform all manner of skilled work.

questions.question: True or False: Exodus 35 forbids the kindling of fire on the Sabbath but allows work related to the tabernacle on that day.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2-3 forbids any work on the Sabbath, including kindling fire, without exception for tabernacle work.

questions.question: What is the significance of the phrase 'willing heart' in the context of the offerings for the tabernacle in Exodus 35?
options: It emphasizes voluntary, joyful giving rather than compulsion
It denotes a legal obligation to give
It restricts offerings to only men
It requires offerings to be paid in full
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes voluntary, joyful giving rather than compulsion
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5 and 35:21 stress that the offerings must come from those whose hearts are stirred and willing, highlighting freewill offerings.

questions.question: How does the description of the tabernacle work in Exodus 35 foreshadow New Testament themes?
options: The tabernacle as God's dwelling among His people prefigures Christ as the ultimate meeting place of God and man
The construction materials symbolize the Roman Empire
The tabernacle was built to be a political center
The offerings represent only Old Testament ritual with no New Testament significance
questions.correctAnswer: The tabernacle as God's dwelling among His people prefigures Christ as the ultimate meeting place of God and man
questions.explanation: The tabernacle theme in Exodus 35 anticipates the incarnation and indwelling of God in Christ, as reflected in John 1:14 and Hebrews 9, highlighting God’s desire to dwell with humanity.

questions.question: What does the Hebrew word for 'holy garments' in Exodus 35:19 imply about their purpose?
options: Consecrated for priestly service and set apart from common use
Ordinary clothing for daily wear
Military armor for protection
Casual attire for festivals
questions.correctAnswer: Consecrated for priestly service and set apart from common use
questions.explanation: The term 'holy garments' (Hebrew: beged qodesh) signifies garments set apart for sacred duties of the priests, emphasizing separation and sanctity in worship (Exodus 35:19).

theological.title: Exodus Chapter 35 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Exodus Chapter 35 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What divine command regarding work and rest is emphasized in Exodus 35, illustrating God's holiness and the call to obedience?
options: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy Sabbath rest
Work is allowed every day without restriction
Only priests are required to rest on the seventh day
Work on the seventh day is encouraged as a form of worship
questions.correctAnswer: Six days shall work be done, but on the seventh day there shall be a holy Sabbath rest
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2 commands six days of work and a Sabbath rest on the seventh day. This rest is a holy day dedicated to the LORD, emphasizing God's holiness and humanity’s obedience to His law. This principle is echoed in Genesis 2:2-3, Isaiah 58:13, Hebrews 4:4, and Mark 2:27, affirming the Sabbath's ongoing theological significance.

questions.question: According to Exodus 35, what consequence is given for anyone who does work on the Sabbath day, highlighting the seriousness of God's commandments?
options: They shall be put to death
They shall be fined
They shall be reprimanded by the priests
They shall offer a sacrifice
questions.correctAnswer: They shall be put to death
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:2 states that anyone who works on the Sabbath shall be put to death, showing the gravity of violating God's holy rest. This underscores God’s sovereign authority and the holiness required of His people. Similar severity is found in Exodus 31:14, Numbers 15:32-36, and reinforced by the holiness code in Leviticus 19:30. In the New Testament, Jesus upholds Sabbath holiness but reveals its true intent (Matthew 12:1-12).

questions.question: In Exodus 35, which items are the Israelites instructed to bring as offerings for the construction and service of the tabernacle?
options: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, badgers' skins, and shittim wood
Only gold and silver
Only fine linen and goats' hair
Iron, wood, and wool
questions.correctAnswer: Gold, silver, brass, blue, purple, scarlet, fine linen, goats' hair, rams' skins dyed red, badgers' skins, and shittim wood
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5-7 lists a detailed inventory of materials offered by the Israelites for the tabernacle, reflecting their willing hearts to contribute to God's holy dwelling. This provision emphasizes human responsibility and divine provision, paralleling materials listed in Exodus 25:3-7 and 36:3-7, showing continuity in God's design for worship spaces. These materials symbolize purity and beauty, pointing toward Christ as the true sanctuary (Hebrews 9:11-12).

questions.question: Who is described in Exodus 35 as being filled with the Spirit of God, endowed with wisdom, understanding, and knowledge to perform all manner of workmanship for the tabernacle?
options: Bezaleel, son of Uri, of the tribe of Judah
Moses, son of Amram
Aaron, brother of Moses
Aholiab, son of Ahisamach
questions.correctAnswer: Bezaleel, son of Uri, of the tribe of Judah
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:30-31 identifies Bezaleel as filled with the Spirit of God, granting him wisdom and skill for tabernacle work. This highlights the pneumatological truth that God equips His servants for His purposes. His gifting is consistent with Old Testament examples like Bezalel and Oholiab (Exodus 36:1-2) and New Testament affirmations of Spirit-empowered service (1 Corinthians 12:4-11; Acts 4:29-31).

questions.question: What role do the willing hearts and spirits of the Israelites play in the tabernacle's construction, according to Exodus 35?
options: They bring offerings and participate joyfully in the work
They are forced to contribute by law
They only observe without participating
They must pay a tax but not offer materials
questions.correctAnswer: They bring offerings and participate joyfully in the work
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:21-22 describes how every man and woman whose heart stirred them came willingly with offerings, emphasizing voluntary participation motivated by the Spirit. This reflects the theological principle of joyful giving and service (2 Corinthians 9:7; Exodus 25:2; Psalm 110:3; Romans 12:11).

questions.question: Which specific types of garments and cloths are mentioned in Exodus 35 as necessary for service in the holy place and for Aaron and his sons?
options: Holy garments for Aaron the priest and his sons, cloths of service, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen
Simple woolen robes without decoration
Leather garments only
Golden crowns and sashes
questions.correctAnswer: Holy garments for Aaron the priest and his sons, cloths of service, blue, purple, scarlet, and fine linen
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:19 specifies the holy garments and cloths of service for Aaron and his sons, made with specified colors and fine linen, signifying holiness and separation for priestly duties. This aligns with Leviticus 8:7-9 and Hebrews 7:26, highlighting Christ as the ultimate High Priest clothed in holiness.

questions.question: What is the significance of the prohibition against kindling fire in the habitations on the Sabbath, as stated in Exodus 35:3?
options: It emphasizes complete cessation of work and dedication to rest and holiness
It allows for cooking but forbids heating
It permits fire only for sacrifices
It is a minor rule without theological weight
questions.correctAnswer: It emphasizes complete cessation of work and dedication to rest and holiness
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:3 commands no fire to be kindled on the Sabbath, underscoring the total rest and sanctification of the day. This command reflects God's holiness and the call for His people to cease ordinary labors, as supported in Exodus 20:8-11, Leviticus 23:3, Jeremiah 17:21, and Hebrews 4:9-10.

questions.question: In Exodus 35, who is named alongside Bezaleel as being taught by God to perform skillful work for the tabernacle, and from which tribe does he come?
options: Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan
Eleazar, son of Aaron, of the tribe of Levi
Nadab, son of Aaron, of the tribe of Levi
Hur, companion of Moses, of the tribe of Judah
questions.correctAnswer: Aholiab, son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:34 identifies Aholiab as another Spirit-filled artisan taught by God for the tabernacle work, emphasizing divine empowerment beyond one individual. This shows God's sovereign choice across tribes (Judah and Dan) and parallels the Spirit’s role in equipping servants (1 Chronicles 2:50; Exodus 36:1; Ephesians 4:11-13).

questions.question: What theological truth about God's provision and human response is taught through the detailed listing of materials and the people's offerings in Exodus 35?
options: God provides resources through willing hearts for His holy purposes
Materials are to be taken forcibly from the people
The materials are symbolic but not necessary for the tabernacle
Only the priests are responsible for providing materials
questions.correctAnswer: God provides resources through willing hearts for His holy purposes
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:5-9, 21-29 shows that offerings come from willing hearts, highlighting the principle that God’s work is supported through voluntarily given gifts. This reflects principles in 2 Corinthians 8:12, Exodus 25:2, Psalm 110:3, and Acts 20:35 where generosity and stewardship are key in God's kingdom.

questions.question: Which of the following best describes the Spirit of God’s role in equipping Bezaleel and Aholiab as described in Exodus 35?
options: The Spirit grants wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and skill for craftsmanship
The Spirit gives them prophetic visions only
The Spirit appoints them as judges
The Spirit heals their illnesses
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit grants wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and skill for craftsmanship
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:31-35 reveals the Spirit’s role in endowing Bezaleel and Aholiab with wisdom, understanding, knowledge, and craftsmanship abilities. This demonstrates the Spirit’s diverse empowerment for service, consistent with Old Testament examples (Isaiah 11:2; Exodus 28:3) and New Testament teaching on spiritual gifts (1 Corinthians 12:7-11; Romans 12:6).

questions.question: What is the significance of the inclusion of both men and women in bringing offerings for the tabernacle work as described in Exodus 35:22?
options: It shows the communal and inclusive nature of worship and service to God
Only men were actually allowed to work on the tabernacle
Women only observed and did not participate
Only men were required to give offerings
questions.correctAnswer: It shows the communal and inclusive nature of worship and service to God
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:22 highlights that both men and women, as many as were willing-hearted, brought offerings. This inclusivity underscores the priesthood of all believers and communal responsibility, resonating with Galatians 3:28, Acts 2:17-18, Joel 2:28-29, and 1 Peter 2:9.

questions.question: Which materials mentioned in Exodus 35 are used specifically for anointing oil and sweet incense, symbolizing holiness and prayer?
options: Oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and sweet incense
Only gold and silver
Goats’ hair and fine linen
Onyx stones and shittim wood
questions.correctAnswer: Oil for the light, spices for anointing oil, and sweet incense
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:8 and 35:28 mention oil for light, spices for anointing oil, and sweet incense, which are significant for worship and sanctification. These elements point to God’s presence and prayer, as supported by Exodus 30:22-38, Leviticus 16:12-13, Psalm 141:2, and Revelation 8:3-4.

questions.question: What does the careful instruction and craftsmanship for the tabernacle in Exodus 35 reveal about God's nature and His desire for worship?
options: God is holy and desires worship that reflects His glory through beauty and order
God accepts any form of worship without concern for details
God prefers spontaneous worship without structure
God does not care about material offerings
questions.correctAnswer: God is holy and desires worship that reflects His glory through beauty and order
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:10-19 details the precise making of the tabernacle and its furnishings, showing God’s holiness and the call for reverence expressed in worship. This is consistent with Isaiah 6:3, Psalm 29:2, 1 Corinthians 14:40, and Revelation 4:8, emphasizing that worship should honor God's holiness and majesty.

questions.question: How does the role of the Spirit in empowering individuals for tabernacle work in Exodus 35 relate to New Testament teachings about spiritual gifts?
options: It prefigures the Holy Spirit distributing diverse gifts for the common good
It is unrelated to New Testament spiritual gifts
The Spirit only empowers prophets, not craftsmen
Spiritual gifts are only for apostolic ministry
questions.correctAnswer: It prefigures the Holy Spirit distributing diverse gifts for the common good
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:31-35 shows God filling Bezaleel and Aholiab with the Spirit for skillful work, prefiguring the New Testament teaching that the Holy Spirit distributes varied gifts for building the church (1 Corinthians 12:4-11; Romans 12:6-8; Ephesians 4:11-13; 1 Peter 4:10). This demonstrates God’s ongoing work through the Spirit in empowering His people.

questions.question: What does the gathering and willing offering of the Israelites in Exodus 35 teach about human response to divine calling in salvation history?
options: Faithful response involves willing, generous participation in God’s work
Salvation is only about individual belief without communal action
God forces people to obey without choice
Material offerings are irrelevant to worship
questions.correctAnswer: Faithful response involves willing, generous participation in God’s work
questions.explanation: Exodus 35:20-29 highlights the Israelites' willing hearts in giving offerings, teaching that human response to God's call includes voluntary participation and stewardship. This aligns with biblical theology on faith and works (James 2:14-26; 2 Corinthians 9:7; Romans 12:1; Hebrews 13:16), emphasizing that salvation history involves both grace and human obedience.
